properties.DESCRIPTION: Starting in the late 1980s, pelicans have been sighted here, which is further north than their previous range.
In the last four years, pinfish have appeared here. This is the first time they've been seen in this location.

There have been new species arrivals and changes in previously seen species: Speckled trout are now seen year round, as are Puppy drum.  Tarpon first arrived in 1965-66 and are now seen every summer; the number of black sea urchins has grown substantially; grouper are now caught here in summer; Triple Tail are moving north from the Carolinas, but Gray Trout counts are declining; seal counts are up; non-breeding Pelicans and Brandt geese stay longer in our region, but there are fewer Brandts than in previous years. Coyotes have been sighted in Northampton County; mink are no longer seen; and deer numbers increased exponentially since 1947 when there was no deer season. Marsh rail numbers have been steady, but the quail population is much lower than in previous years.
